name: Chalet Suzanne Country Inn

reviews.title: Good things come to he that waits!
reviews.text: My family was from Lake Wales, so I've been visiting the place since I was a child in the sixties. It was always a special treat to dine at the Florida Golden Spoon awarded restaurant. And if you haven't visited or stayed in the Inn, it captures the imagination of young and old!

I had heard that the establishment had taken a beating during the hurricanes of 1995 and looked pretty rough. On our recent visit, I was surprised to find the place looked like it had rebounded well. The business is run by the third generation of the Hinshaws. They are very cordial and graceful.
reviews.title: This is what Family Owned B&B's should be!

reviews.text: On to their dining, like other restaurants they are challenged in this economy. However at dinner, we splurged on the five course offering and were very happy we did so! The offerings for breakfast are limited but delicious.
reviews.title: Unique Experience

reviews.text: Regarding room recommendations - Governor North is over-the-top and worth it. I have also enjoyed Holiday and the Tower room.
reviews.title: Beware - don't go there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are friendly down to earth folks - very refreshing in this day. Their staff is top notch! Our room was amazing - we brought 6 other couples with us on motorcycles and everyone enjoyed the rooms, food and tour of the soup plant! We will be back - very soon!
reviews.title: Worth going out of your way for...

reviews.text: the charm and faded glory are evident. the breakfast, included in the charge, was delicious. the staff was helpful and friendly. the owner/ family members are in view and eager to please. i hate to say anything negative, but the place is tired.
reviews.title: one project a month...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one project a month is all it would take. have matching lightbulbs in the bathrooms, change
reviews.title: Chalet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: some rusty fixtures, do a painting project, install new blinds, etc.
reviews.title: My favorite place on Earth.

reviews.text: the basic bones are good. but a few things can't be overlooked.
reviews.title: Interesting...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i'm so sorry if i hurt feelings.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very nice. Dinner left a lot to be desired. Did not like having to order from a menu using a flashlight and not being able to see what you were eating. My husband only had a dish of ice cream and I had coffee rather than to try to order again from the menu with a flashlight for dessert.. Lights outside of windows made trying to sleep very difficult--even with shades closed it was like a spotlight in your eyes all night.
reviews.title: TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, but in all we did not enjoy our stay and would not recommend Chalet Suzanne to anyone.
reviews.title: Always Great, a unique place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chalet Suzanne is a delight. It's not the Hilton, or the Ritz-Carlton—it's shabby chic—a quaint place where time stands still. Great unique food, unique rooms, incredible sheets! Like no other—which is saying a lot in today's world. Go expecting a calm, peaceful place!
reviews.title: A time to Recharge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an intensive week of work in Orlando my wife joined me for a brief weekend get away. We now live in New Mexico but until 1995 I lived in the Tamp Bay Area. I had been a fan of Chalet Suzanne when a resident of Florida. I was married in 2001 and told my wife on many occasions of my fond memories of the excellent dining at the Chalet. So they had a lot to live up to when I was finally able to bring her to Chalet Suzanne. Karen and I were both pleased to see that those memories have been exceeded by excellent food, wonderful friendly staff and the comfortable atmosphere.
reviews.title: A Gem That Has Lost It's Luster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Chalet Suzanne for the wonderful retreat.
reviews.title: A gem of an experience that couples should explore...

reviews.text: I was lucky to have found this gem of a spot in Lake Wales. I stayed for just a short time, but was very impressed with the service, kindness and consideration that was displayed by both the satff and the owners toward their guests. I needed to depart suddently , a cab was unavailable,so the owner personally drove me to my destination. You don't find that at a Marriott!
reviews.title: Amazing customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quaint, charming and I hear the restaurant is amazing.
reviews.title: ...and we had running water too..!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chalet Suzanne, at Lake Wales, Florida looked the ideal spot for relaxation and recuperation on the internet web-site.. However, the day of our arrival was cold and very wet which did nothing much for our aim to relax. Reception is a short distance from the car parking area, sufficiently far enough to get soaked.
reviews.title: Wonderful romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having waited several minutes for the receptionist/manager (Mary-Anne) to acknowledge my presence, (I was the only guest there), formalities were dealt with and I was given the keys to a nearby cottage. No offer of help, nor any directions or even an umbrella as some defense from the incessant rain, despite my disability and mobility problems, was offered until I requested it.
reviews.title: Magical opulence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To say that Chalet Suzanne is shabby chic is to praise it too highly, it is just shabby and over-priced.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

aka: Chalet Suzanne Country Hotel Lake Wales
description: Every one of the Chalet's 26 guestrooms greets you with cordial warmth and each is delightfully unique, with the comforts of private entrance, private bath, air conditioning, telephone and television. Our special Select Request Rooms are larger and have unique amenities such as a king bed, whirlpool tub or a special view. The sparkling pool, lake and airstrip are only a few steps from your courtyard or patio.Included with your room is a welcoming Decanter of Sherry, fresh fruit, a daily Wine and Cheese Reception, a nightly Turndown Service with Homade Sweets and a delicious Country Inn Breakfast served in the Lakeside Dining Room.While staying with us tour our historic Soup Cannery, home of NASA's Moon Soups, or go to the water's edge and feed the many wild turtles that call Lake Suzanne their home. Watch the colorful parachutes as they gracefully approach for a landing on our airstrip, or schedule a Tandem Skydive for yourself!Please come! We are looking forward to your visit...Eric and Dee 3rd Generation Owners
